policyFindings: Only cats and dogs are accepted as pets; capacity is limited. One animal per carrier and one pet per passenger in the cabin and/or hold, subject to capacity and booking confirmation.

In-cabin PETC container must be IATA LAR-compliant, ventilated, waterproof and lockable; pet must remain under the seat and be able to stand, turn, and lie naturally. Maximum container size 55 x 40 x 20 cm; one animal per carrier.

In-cabin weight limit: pet + carrier up to 8 kg. The PETC container counts in addition to normal cabin baggage. Reservations accepted up to 24 hours before departure. Passengers must bring the completed Live Animal Acceptance Checklist to check-in.
Seat restrictions: pets in cabin are not permitted in Business Class on A330neo aircraft, exit rows, or seats behind a partition.

In-cabin fees (per flight/one-way): Zone 5 USA/Canada USD 115 if pre-registered; higher airport fee USD 190/CAD 245. Zone 1 USD 75 (USD 145 at airport). Zone 2+6 USD 90 (USD 160 at airport). Zone 3+7 USD 115 (USD 190 at airport). Zone 4 USD 115 (USD 190 at airport). USA/Canada are Zone 5.

Pets in the cargo hold are only possible on direct (nonstop) Condor-operated flights; bookings accepted up to 48 hours before departure. Provide total weight (animal + crate), exact crate dimensions, and dog breed. Bring the Live Animal Acceptance Checklist to check-in.

Cargo-hold crate requirements: IATA LAR compliant; ventilated; waterproof base lined with absorbent material; escape-proof; with water/food containers; animal must stand without head/ears touching the roof and turn/lie naturally.
Cargo-hold environment: approximately 10°C on short/medium-haul and approximately 18–23°C on long-haul; ventilation on all routes.

Cargo fees per flight/one-way with two size tiers: up to 80 x 55 x 100 cm and up to 125 x 75 x 100 cm. Zone 5 USA/Canada: USD 185/310 pre-registered; airport check-in higher at USD 260/380 (CAD amounts shown on page). Other zones: Zone 1 USD 95/185; Zone 2+6 USD 125/240; Zone 3+7 USD 185/310; Zone 4 USD 185/310.

Breed restrictions: listed fighting dog types are generally not accepted (e.g., Pitbull-Terrier, American Pitbull, American Staffordshire Terrier, Staffordshire Bullterrier, Bullterrier, American Bulldog, Dogo Argentino, Fila Brasileiro, Karabash/Kangal/Anatolian Shepherd, Caucasian Ovcharka, Mastiff, Mastino Napoletano, Rottweiler). Applies to mixed breeds.

Brachycephalic (snub‑nosed) dogs and cats are not accepted for transport as pets due to health risks; listed examples include Pugs, Bulldogs, Boxers, Shih Tzu, Persian, Himalayan, etc. Applies to mixed breeds.

Destination embargo: no pets accepted (neither cabin nor hold) to/from Antigua; Barbados (cruise flights only, flight numbers starting with 3); China; Dubai; Great Britain; Jamaica; Mauritius; Panama; Sharjah; South Africa.
Hold embargo (cabin allowed) to/from Beirut; Egypt; Erevan; Las Vegas (May–September); Phoenix; Sulaymaniyah.
Routing: Condor transports animals only on Condor nonstop flights; no transfers between different carriers for animal crates; no hold transport on itineraries with partner airline connections.

Age and health rules: within the EU the animal must be at least 4 months old; from unlisted third countries to the EU at least 7 months (example: dogs to the USA 6 months). Sick/injured animals, animals likely to give birth during the flight, or those that gave birth within 48 hours are not accepted. Sedated pets must respond when spoken to.
Rabies/USA: Dogs that have been in CDC-designated high‑risk rabies countries within the last 6 months are excluded; other dogs traveling to the USA require the CDC Dog Import Form.

Service animals: only trained assistance/service dogs are accepted in the cabin. On US routes, the DOT Service Animal Air Transportation Form is required (and DOT Relief Attestation if flight duration is 8 hours or more). Pre-book at least 48 hours before departure is recommended.
Service dogs travel free of charge. Dogs that are not trained assistance dogs must travel under the pet policy with applicable rules and fees.
Service dog behavior/handling: must not block aisles or exits; should not be tranquilized; must obey commands and behave non‑aggressively; passenger is responsible for the dog’s needs.
notes: Research method: Started from the Condor Travelling with pets overview and followed only official child links to Pets in Cabin, Pets in the Cargo Hold, Conditions and Regulations, Assistance Dogs, Flight Zones, Optional Fees, and the Live Animal Acceptance Checklist PDF.

Weight limit discrepancy: Pet-in-cabin pages and the Acceptance Checklist state 8 kg (pet + carrier) with max 55 x 40 x 20 cm, while the Optional Services fee summary shows 6 kg. The pet-specific pages and checklist appear more authoritative operationally; reconfirm at booking.

Emotional support animals: Condor accepts only trained assistance dogs; ESAs are not recognized as service animals on US routes and must travel under the pet policy. Follow the US Assistance Dogs page.
Routing limits: Condor will not accept pets for transfer between different airlines; animal carriage is only on Condor nonstop flights.

Seasonal/destination embargoes: e.g., Las Vegas (May–September) and Phoenix have hold embargoes, and several destinations do not accept pets at all. These restrictions can change; confirm on the Conditions and Regulations page close to travel.

finalDoc.PetPolicySummary: Condor accepts only dogs and cats, subject to limited capacity and confirmed reservation, and only on Condor-operated nonstop flights. One animal per carrier; typically one pet per passenger. In cabin (PETC): the pet must remain in a closed, IATA-compliant, ventilated, waterproof, lockable carrier under the seat, with max size 55 x 40 x 20 cm and max total weight (pet + carrier) 8 kg. The carrier counts in addition to normal cabin baggage. PETC is not permitted in Business Class on A330neo aircraft, at exit rows, or behind partitions. Reservations are accepted up to 24 hours before departure, and passengers must bring the completed Live Animal Acceptance Checklist. In-cabin fees vary by zone (e.g., USA/Canada Zone 5: USD 115 when pre-registered; higher at airport). In the cargo hold (AVIH): only on direct flights and bookable up to 48 hours before departure; provide animal+crate weight, crate dimensions, and dog breed. Crates must comply with IATA LAR, be escape-proof with a watertight base lined with absorbent material, and include water/food containers; the animal must be able to stand without head/ears touching the roof and turn/lie naturally. Ventilated holds are approx. 10°C on short/medium haul and 18–23°C on long haul. Cargo fees vary by zone and crate size (e.g., USA/Canada Zone 5: USD 185/310 when pre-registered; higher at airport). Destination restrictions apply: no pets at all to/from Antigua; Barbados (cruise flights only); China; Dubai; Great Britain; Jamaica; Mauritius; Panama; Sharjah; South Africa. Hold embargo (cabin may be allowed) for Beirut; Egypt; Erevan; Las Vegas (May–September); Phoenix; Sulaymaniyah. Listed fighting dog types and brachycephalic breeds (snub-nosed dogs and cats) are not accepted, including mixed breeds. Age/entry rules apply (e.g., within the EU at least 4 months old; from unlisted third countries to the EU at least 7 months). On US routes, CDC rules apply (e.g., Dog Import Form; exclusions for dogs from high-risk rabies countries). Only trained assistance/service dogs are accepted in the cabin free of charge; ESAs are not recognized and must travel as pets.
finalDoc.ImprovedPetPolicySummary:
Condor Pet Policy (Dogs & Cats only)

  • Only accepted with confirmed reservation on Condor-operated nonstop flights; capacity limited. One animal per carrier; typically max one pet per passenger.
  • Compliance: Follow IATA Live Animal Regulations and bring the completed Condor Live Animal Acceptance Checklist to check-in.

Pets in Cabin (PETC)

  • Carrier: IATA-compliant, ventilated, waterproof, lockable; must fit under seat. Max size 55 x 40 x 20 cm; max combined weight (pet + carrier) 8 kg.
  • Pet must remain fully inside the closed carrier and be able to stand, turn, and lie naturally.
  • Counts in addition to the normal cabin baggage allowance.
  • Seat restrictions: Not permitted in Business Class on A330neo aircraft, at exit rows, or behind partitions.
  • Booking cutoff: up to 24 hours before departure.

In-Cabin Fees (one-way, pre-registered / airport)

  • Zone 1: USD 75 / USD 145
  • Zone 2 + 6: USD 90 / USD 160
  • Zone 3 + 7: USD 115 / USD 190
  • Zone 4: USD 115 / USD 190
  • Zone 5 (USA/Canada): USD 115 / USD 190

Unregistered animals at airport check-in incur higher fees and transport cannot be guaranteed.

Pets in the Cargo Hold (AVIH)

  • Flights: Only on direct Condor flights; book up to 48 hours before departure. Provide total weight (animal + crate), exact crate dimensions, and dog breed.
  • Crate: IATA LAR compliant; escape-proof; ventilated; watertight base lined with absorbent material; with water/food containers. Animal must stand without head/ears touching the roof, turn around, and lie naturally.
  • Hold environment: approx. 10°C on short/medium haul; approx. 18–23°C on long haul; ventilated.

Cargo Fees (one-way, pre-registered)

Two size tiers: up to 80 x 55 x 100 cm / up to 125 x 75 x 100 cm.

  • Zone 1: USD 95 / USD 185
  • Zone 2 + 6: USD 125 / USD 240
  • Zone 3 + 7: USD 185 / USD 310
  • Zone 4: USD 185 / USD 310
  • Zone 5 (USA/Canada): USD 185 / USD 310 (at airport: USD 260 / USD 380)

At-airport fees are higher and space is not guaranteed.

Restrictions

  • No pets (cabin or hold) to/from: Antigua; Barbados (cruise flights, flight numbers starting with 3); China; Dubai; Great Britain; Jamaica; Mauritius; Panama; Sharjah; South Africa.
  • Hold embargo (cabin may be allowed) to/from: Beirut; Egypt; Erevan; Las Vegas (May–September); Phoenix; Sulaymaniyah.
  • Brachycephalic (snub-nosed) breeds are not accepted. Listed/”fighting” dog types are not accepted. Applies to mixed breeds.
  • Age/entry: Within EU typically ≥4 months; from unlisted third countries to EU typically ≥7 months. Follow all destination-specific veterinary and entry rules.
  • USA: CDC rules apply (e.g., Dog Import Form; bans from high-risk rabies countries within last 6 months).

Service Animals

  • Only trained assistance/service dogs accepted in the cabin free of charge. Pre-booking at least 48 hours recommended.
  • US routes: DOT Service Animal Air Transportation Form required (and DOT Relief Attestation if flight ≥8 hours).
  • Dog must behave appropriately and must not block aisles or exits.
  • Emotional Support Animals are not recognized; they must travel as pets under the standard pet policy and fees.

Refer to Condor's official pages for Flight Zones, Optional Service Fees, and current restrictions before booking.
finalDoc.inCompartmentDetails: Only dogs and cats accepted; capacity limited. One pet per passenger and one animal per IATA-compliant carrier. Carrier max 55 x 40 x 20 cm; total weight (pet + carrier) up to 8 kg. Pet must remain in the closed carrier under the seat and be able to stand, turn, and lie naturally. Counts in addition to cabin baggage. Reservations up to 24 hours before departure; bring the Live Animal Acceptance Checklist. Not allowed in Business Class on A330neo aircraft, at exit rows, or behind partitions. Only on Condor nonstop flights.
finalDoc.inCargoDetails: Only on Condor-operated nonstop flights; book up to 48 hours before departure. Provide total weight (animal + crate), crate dimensions, and dog breed. Crate must be IATA LAR compliant, escape-proof, ventilated, with a watertight base lined with absorbent material and water/food containers; animal must stand without head/ears touching the roof and turn/lie naturally. Hold temperature approx. 10°C (short/medium haul) and 18–23°C (long haul). Some destinations do not accept pets at all; some permit cabin only (no hold). No interline transfers for animals. Sedated pets must respond when spoken to; sick, injured, or pregnant animals (or those that gave birth within 48 hours) are not accepted.
finalDoc.carrierCompartmentDetails:
In-Cabin Pet Carrier Rules

  • Only small cats and dogs; limited capacity; one pet per passenger.
  • Carrier must be IATA LAR compliant: ventilated, waterproof, lockable, and escape-proof.
  • Max carrier size: 55 cm x 40 cm x 20 cm.
  • Max weight (pet + carrier): 8 kg.
  • Pet must remain fully inside the closed carrier under the seat and be able to stand, turn, and lie naturally.
  • Counts in addition to the regular cabin baggage allowance.
  • Reservation accepted up to 24 hours before departure; bring the Live Animal Acceptance Checklist to check-in.
  • Not permitted in Business Class on A330neo aircraft, exit rows, or seats behind partitions.

Fees (one-way)

Flight ZonePre-registeredAt airport
Zone 1USD 75USD 145
Zone 2 + 6USD 90USD 160
Zone 3 + 7USD 115USD 190
Zone 4USD 115USD 190
Zone 5 (USA/Canada)USD 115USD 190

Unregistered animals at airport check-in incur higher fees and transport cannot be guaranteed.
finalDoc.carrierCargoDetails:
Checked/Cargo Pet Transport Rules

  • Dogs and cats only; limited capacity per flight.
  • Direct Condor flights only; bookings accepted up to 48 hours before departure.
  • IATA LAR-compliant crate required: ventilated, escape-proof, watertight base lined with absorbent material, with water/food containers. Animal must stand without head/ears touching the roof and turn/lie naturally.
  • Provide total weight (animal + crate), exact crate dimensions, and dog breed; bring the Live Animal Acceptance Checklist.
  • Hold environment: approx. 10°C on short/medium haul; approx. 18–23°C on long haul; ventilation provided.

Fees (one-way, pre-registered)

Two size tiers: up to 80 x 55 x 100 cm / up to 125 x 75 x 100 cm.

Flight ZoneSmaller crateLarger crate
Zone 1USD 95USD 185
Zone 2 + 6USD 125USD 240
Zone 3 + 7USD 185USD 310
Zone 4USD 185USD 310
Zone 5 (USA/Canada)USD 185USD 310

At-airport fees are higher; for Zone 5, airport check-in is USD 260 / USD 380. Space and transport cannot be guaranteed for unregistered animals.

Additional Restrictions

  • No pets at all (cabin or hold) to/from: Antigua; Barbados (cruise flights only; flight numbers starting with 3); China; Dubai; Great Britain; Jamaica; Mauritius; Panama; Sharjah; South Africa.
  • Hold embargo (cabin may be allowed): Beirut; Egypt; Erevan; Las Vegas (May–September); Phoenix; Sulaymaniyah.
finalDoc.dangerousBreedList: Pitbull Terrier, American Pitbull, American Staffordshire Terrier, Staffordshire Bullterrier, Bullterrier, American Bulldog, Dogo Argentino, Fila Brasileiro, Karabash/Kangal/Anatolian Shepherd, Caucasian Ovcharka, Mastiff, Mastino Napoletano, Rottweiler
finalDoc.brachycephalicBreedList: Pug, Bulldog (English/French), Boxer, Shih Tzu, Pekingese, Boston Terrier, Persian (cat), Himalayan (cat), Exotic Shorthair (cat)
finalDoc.serviceAnimalDetails: Only trained assistance/service dogs are accepted in the cabin free of charge. Pre-booking at least 48 hours before departure is recommended. On US routes, the DOT Service Animal Air Transportation Form is required, and the DOT Relief Attestation is required if the flight is 8 hours or more. The dog must behave appropriately, may not block aisles or exits, and should not be tranquilized. Non-trained dogs must travel under the pet policy with applicable rules and fees.
